paragraph.string: The Michigan Department of Health and Human Services is committed to providing quality and evidence-based pharmacy services to behavioral health patients. In an effort to collaborate and assist you in providing safe, appropriate, and cost-effective care to your patients, we have implemented the Magellan Whole Health Rx Consultation Program. As part of this program, drug utilization algorithms based on evidence based guidelines are used to identify any potential drug therapy concerns.

This letter has been generated because we have identified a member-specific quality opportunity. Please review the clinical information at the top of each page and the corresponding patient list to determine if a change in therapy can be made.
This program is informational in nature and is not intended to replace your authority, responsibility, or accountability for patient care.

A clinical pharmacist may contact you to schedule a consultation or come to your office to meet with you to discuss how the information can be used to improve the quality of care and reduce the risks of adverse events. You can also use the contact information below to contact a clinical pharmacist to request a personal consultation, provide feedback, ask questions, or request additional data.

All patients listed in this document have received a paid prescription with your national identification number (NPI) identified as the prescriber. Please be aware some of these patients may have received a prescription from you at a different site of service as this mailing is directed to the address primarily associated with your DEA.

Trish M. Bouck, MPA, RN
Director, Pharmacy Management Division
Bureau of Medicaid Care Management & Quality Assurance
Medical Services Administration
Michigan Department of Health and Human Services cc: Enclosure

In an effort to collaborate and assist you in providing safe, appropriate and cost-effective care to your patients, we are reaching out as part of our Academic Detailing Program. This letter has been generated because we have identified a member-specific medication improvement opportunity. Please review the clinical information at the top of each page and the corresponding patient list to determine if a change in therapy can be made.

paragraph.string: How to Safely Dispose of Unused Prescription Medications

Storing your medications safely and disposing of the ones you no longer need can make a difference when it comes to preventing medication injuries. It can also prevent medications from getting into the wrong hands.

default.Chinese: 請安全地存放藥物並處理掉您不再需要的藥物，這樣做不僅可以有效避免藥物傷害，還能防止藥物落入壞人之手。
default.Spanish: Almacenar sus medicamentos de manera segura y desechar los que ya no necesita puede hacer una diferencia en la prevención de lesiones causadas por medicamentos. También puede evitar que los medicamentos caigan en las manos equivocadas.
Cómo almacenar los medicamentos de manera segura:

items: Make sure your medications are stored in their original container and the cap is on tight.
Place your medications in a safe location and never leave it in an unsecured place, such as the kitchen counter.
Store your medications where children cannot see or reach them.

Chinese: 確保您的藥物存放在原來的容器中，並且蓋緊了蓋子。
將藥物放在安全的地方，而切勿將其放在沒有安全保障的地方，如廚房櫃檯。
將藥物存放在兒童看不到或夠不著的地方。
Spanish: Conserve los medicamentos en sus envases originales con la tapa bien cerrada.
Coloque los medicamentos en un lugar seguro y no los deje nunca en un lugar que no sea seguro, como la encimera de la cocina.
Guarde los medicamentos en un sitio donde los niños no puedan verlos ni alcanzarlos.

default.Spanish: Cómo deshacerse de los medicamentos de forma segura:

items: Dispose of medications you no longer use or are expired as soon as possible. This will prevent you and others from accidentally taking medications you no longer need.

Chinese: 盡快處理您不再使用或過期的藥物。這將防止您和其他人意外地服用您不再需要的藥物。
Spanish: Deseche los medicamentos que ya no usa o que están vencidos lo antes posible. Esto evitará que usted u otras personas tomen accidentalmente medicamentos que ya no necesitan.

default.Spanish: Programas de devolución de medicamentos cerca de su domicilio:

items: The preferred way of disposing unused controlled medications is to bring them to community take-back sites near you.
Before bringing your medications to take-back sites, use a marker to cover any personal information, such as your name or prescription number. Two medication take-back sites in your community are:

Chinese: 處理未使用的受管制藥物的首選方式是將它們帶到您附近的社區回收點。
在將藥物帶到回收點之前，請使用記號筆塗抹掉任何個人資訊，例如您的姓名或處方號。您所在社區的兩個藥物回收點是:
Spanish: La mejor forma de desechar los medicamentos controlados sin usar es llevarlos a los sitios de devolución de la comunidad cerca de su domicilio.

Antes de llevar sus medicamentos a los sitios de devolución, cubra con un marcador cualquier información personal, como su nombre o número de receta. Los siguientes son dos sitios de devolución de medicamentos en su comunidad:

items: The US Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) allows unused prescription medications to be mailed back to pharmacies or other authorized sites using packages made available at pharmacies or other drug disposal sites. Contact your local pharmacy prior to mailing unused medications.

Other medication collection sites in your area and information about medication disposal may be found at the websites below:
o       Information regarding drug take back: https://www.deatakeback.com/
o       Additional take-back sites near you: https://bit.ly/3guWP4x

Chinese: 美國緝毒署 (Drug Enforcement Administration, DEA) 允許您使用藥房或其他藥物處理點提供的包裝，將未使用的處方藥郵寄回藥房或其他授權點。在郵寄未使用的藥物前，請聯絡您當地的 藥房。

您可在以下網站找到您所在地區的其他藥物收集點和有關藥物處理的資訊:
o       有關藥物回收的資訊: https://www.deatakeback.com/
o       您附近的其他回收點: https://apps2.deadiversion.usdoj.gov/pubdispsearch/spring/main?execution=e2s1
Spanish: La Administración para el Control de Drogas (Drug Enforcement Administration, DEA) de los EE. UU. permite que los medicamentos con receta sin usar se devuelvan por correo a las farmacias u otros sitios autorizados utilizando paquetes disponibles en las farmacias u otros sitios para la eliminación de medicamentos. Comuníquese con su farmacia local antes de enviar por correo los medicamentos sin usar.

Puede encontrar otros sitios de recolección de medicamentos en su área e información sobre cómo desechar los medicamentos en los siguientes sitios web:
o       Información sobre la devolución de los medicamentos: https://www.deatakeback.com/
o       Otros sitios de devolución cerca de su domicilio: https://apps2.deadiversion.usdoj.gov/pubdispsearch/spring/main?execution=e2s1

English: The US Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) allows unused prescription medications to be mailed back to pharmacies or other authorized sites using packages made available at pharmacies or other drug disposal sites. Contact your local pharmacy prior to mailing unused medications.

Other medication collection sites in your area and information about medication disposal may be found at the websites below:
o       Information regarding drug take back: https://www.deatakeback.com/
o       Additional take-back sites near you: https://bit.ly/3guWP4x
Spanish: La Administración para el Control de Drogas (Drug Enforcement Administration, DEA) de los EE. UU. permite que los medicamentos con receta sin usar se devuelvan por correo a las farmacias u otros sitios autorizados utilizando paquetes disponibles en las farmacias u otros sitios para la eliminación de medicamentos. Comuníquese con su farmacia local antes de enviar por correo los medicamentos sin usar.

Puede encontrar otros sitios de recolección de medicamentos en su área e información sobre cómo desechar los medicamentos en los siguientes sitios web:
o       Información sobre la devolución de los medicamentos: https://www.deatakeback.com/
o       Otros sitios de devolución cerca de su domicilio: https://bit.ly/3guWP4x

default.Spanish: Otras formas de deshacerse de los medicamentos:

items: Remove the medications from their original containers and mix them with something undesirable, such as used coffee grounds, dirt, or cat litter.
Put the mixture in something you can close, such as a zip-lock bag, to prevent the medicine from spilling out. Then throw the container in the trash.
Some prescription medications may be safely flushed. Please visit https://bit.ly/3TmFnO2 for a list of flushable medications.
If you have any questions about your medications, ask your doctor or pharmacist.

Chinese: 從原來的容器中取出藥物，將其與不需要的東西混合，如用過的咖啡渣、泥土或貓砂。
將混合物放入可以封閉的容器(例如一個拉鏈袋)內，以防止藥物溢出。然後將容器扔進 垃圾桶。
某些處方藥可以安全地沖走。請瀏覽 <u>https://www.fda.gov/drugs/disposal-unused-medicines-what-you-should-know/drug-disposal-fdas-flush-list-certain-medicines</u> 查看可沖走的藥物清單。
如果您對藥物有任何疑問，請諮詢您的醫生或藥劑師。
Spanish: Retire los medicamentos de sus envases originales y mézclelos con alguna sustancia desagradable, como granos de café usados, tierra o arena sanitaria para gatos.
Coloque la mezcla en algún contenedor que pueda cerrar como una bolsa con cierre hermético, para evitar que el medicamento se derrame. Luego, tire el recipiente a la basura.

Algunos medicamentos recetados pueden desecharse por el inodoro de manera segura. Ingrese en link <u>https://www.fda.gov/drugs/disposal-unused-medicines-what-you-should-know/drug-disposal-fdas-flush-list-certain-medicines</u> para obtener un listado de los medicamentos que se pueden desechar por el inodoro.
Si tiene alguna pregunta sobre sus medicamentos, consulte a su médico o farmacéutico.

English: Remove the medications from their original containers and mix them with something undesirable, such as used coffee grounds, dirt, or cat litter.
Put the mixture in something you can close, such as a zip-lock bag, to prevent the medicine from spilling out. Then throw the container in the trash.
Some prescription medications may be safely flushed. Please visit https://bit.ly/3TmFnO2 for a list of flushable medications.
If you have any questions about your medications, ask your doctor or pharmacist.
Spanish: Retire los medicamentos de sus envases originales y mézclelos con alguna sustancia desagradable, como granos de café usados, tierra o arena sanitaria para gatos.
Coloque la mezcla en algún contenedor que pueda cerrar como una bolsa con cierre hermético, para evitar que el medicamento se derrame. Luego, tire el recipiente a la basura.

Algunos medicamentos recetados pueden desecharse por el inodoro de manera segura. Ingrese en <u>https://bit.ly/3TmFnO2</u> para obtener un listado de los medicamentos que se pueden desechar por el inodoro.
Si tiene alguna pregunta sobre sus medicamentos, consulte a su médico o farmacéutico.

paragraph.string: Statin Therapy for Patients with Cardiovascular Disease (SPC) is a Medicare Star Measure. We have reviewed our records and noticed that this patient is currently not taking a moderate to high intensity statin. The ACC/AHA Guideline on the Management of Blood Cholesterol recommends patients < 75 years of age with atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease (ASCVD) to take a high intensity statin to reduce cardiovascular risk, regardless of LDL level. In patients > 75 years of age with atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease (ASCVD), it is reasonable to initiate a moderate to high intensity statin to reduce cardiovascular risk, regardless of LDL level. This patient has a diagnosis indicating atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease (ASCVD).

items: Dispose of medications you no longer use or are expired as soon as possible. This will prevent you and others from accidentally taking medications you no longer need.

Chinese: 盡快處理您不再使用或過期的藥物。這將防止您和其他人意外地服用您不再需要的藥物。
Spanish: Deseche los medicamentos que ya no usa o que están vencidos lo antes posible. Esto evitará que usted u otras personas tomen accidentalmente medicamentos que ya no necesitan.

default.Spanish: Programas de devolución de medicamentos cerca de su domicilio:

items: The preferred way of disposing unused controlled medications is to bring them to community take-back sites near you.
Before bringing your medications to take-back sites, use a marker to cover any personal information, such as your name or prescription number. Two medication take-back sites in your community are:

Chinese: 處理未使用的受管制藥物的首選方式是將它們帶到您附近的社區回收點。
在將藥物帶到回收點之前，請使用記號筆塗抹掉任何個人資訊，例如您的姓名或處方號。您所在社區的兩個藥物回收點是:
Spanish: La mejor forma de desechar los medicamentos controlados sin usar es llevarlos a los sitios de devolución de la comunidad cerca de su domicilio.

Antes de llevar sus medicamentos a los sitios de devolución, cubra con un marcador cualquier información personal, como su nombre o número de receta. Los siguientes son dos sitios de devolución de medicamentos en su comunidad:

items: The US Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) allows unused prescription medications to be mailed back to pharmacies or other authorized sites using packages made available at pharmacies or other drug disposal sites. Contact your local pharmacy prior to mailing unused medications.

Other medication collection sites in your area and information about medication disposal may be found at the websites below:
o       Information regarding drug take back: https://www.deatakeback.com/
o       Additional take-back sites near you: https://apps2.deadiversion.usdoj.gov/pubdispsearch/spring/main?execution=e2s1

Chinese: 美國緝毒署 (Drug Enforcement Administration, DEA) 允許您使用藥房或其他藥物處理點提供的包裝，將未使用的處方藥郵寄回藥房或其他授權點。在郵寄未使用的藥物前，請聯絡您當地的 藥房。

您可在以下網站找到您所在地區的其他藥物收集點和有關藥物處理的資訊:
o       有關藥物回收的資訊: https://www.deatakeback.com/
o       您附近的其他回收點: https://apps2.deadiversion.usdoj.gov/pubdispsearch/spring/main?execution=e2s1
Spanish: La Administración para el Control de Drogas (Drug Enforcement Administration, DEA) de los EE. UU. permite que los medicamentos con receta sin usar se devuelvan por correo a las farmacias u otros sitios autorizados utilizando paquetes disponibles en las farmacias u otros sitios para la eliminación de medicamentos. Comuníquese con su farmacia local antes de enviar por correo los medicamentos sin usar.

Puede encontrar otros sitios de recolección de medicamentos en su área e información sobre cómo desechar los medicamentos en los siguientes sitios web:
o       Información sobre la devolución de los medicamentos: https://www.deatakeback.com/
o       Otros sitios de devolución cerca de su domicilio: https://apps2.deadiversion.usdoj.gov/pubdispsearch/spring/main?execution=e2s1

o       Information regarding drug take back: https://www.deatakeback.com/
o       Additional take-back sites near you: https://bit.ly/3guWP4x

default.Spanish: Otras formas de deshacerse de los medicamentos:

items: Remove the medications from their original containers and mix them with something undesirable, such as used coffee grounds, dirt, or cat litter.
Put the mixture in something you can close, such as a zip-lock bag, to prevent the medicine from spilling out. Then throw the container in the trash.

Some prescription medications may be safely flushed. Please visit https://www.fda.gov/drugs/disposal-unused-medicines-what-you-should-know/drug-disposal-fdas- flush-list-certain-medicines for a list of flushable medications.
If you have any questions about your medications, ask your doctor or pharmacist.

Chinese: 從原來的容器中取出藥物，將其與不需要的東西混合，如用過的咖啡渣、泥土或貓砂。
將混合物放入可以封閉的容器(例如一個拉鏈袋)內，以防止藥物溢出。然後將容器扔進 垃圾桶。
某些處方藥可以安全地沖走。請瀏覽 <u>https://www.fda.gov/drugs/disposal-unused-medicines-what-you-should-know/drug-disposal-fdas- flush-list-certain-medicines</u> 查看可沖走的藥物清單。
如果您對藥物有任何疑問，請諮詢您的醫生或藥劑師。
Spanish: Retire los medicamentos de sus envases originales y mézclelos con alguna sustancia desagradable, como granos de café usados, tierra o arena sanitaria para gatos.
Coloque la mezcla en algún contenedor que pueda cerrar como una bolsa con cierre hermético, para evitar que el medicamento se derrame. Luego, tire el recipiente a la basura.

Algunos medicamentos recetados pueden desecharse por el inodoro de manera segura. Ingrese en link <u>https://www.fda.gov/drugs/disposal-unused-medicines-what-you-should-know/drug-disposal-fdas- flush-list-certain-medicines</u> para obtener un listado de los medicamentos que se pueden desechar por el inodoro.
Si tiene alguna pregunta sobre sus medicamentos, consulte a su médico o farmacéutico.

English: Remove the medications from their original containers and mix them with something undesirable, such as used coffee grounds, dirt, or cat litter.
Put the mixture in something you can close, such as a zip-lock bag, to prevent the medicine from spilling out. Then throw the container in the trash.
Some prescription medications may be safely flushed. Please visit https://bit.ly/3TmFnO2 for a list of flushable medications.
If you have any questions about your medications, ask your doctor or pharmacist.
Spanish: Retire los medicamentos de sus envases originales y mézclelos con alguna sustancia desagradable, como granos de café usados, tierra o arena sanitaria para gatos.
Coloque la mezcla en algún contenedor que pueda cerrar como una bolsa con cierre hermético, para evitar que el medicamento se derrame. Luego, tire el recipiente a la basura.

Algunos medicamentos recetados pueden desecharse por el inodoro de manera segura. Ingrese en <u>https://bit.ly/3TmFnO2</u> para obtener un listado de los medicamentos que se pueden desechar por el inodoro.
Si tiene alguna pregunta sobre sus medicamentos, consulte a su médico o farmacéutico.

paragraph.string:
Dear {patient_full_name},

As part of your AllCare Advantage Medicare plan, we’re pleased to welcome you into our Medication Therapy Management (MTM) program. Because you meet the program criteria based on the number of medications you take, the number of health conditions you have, and your annual prescription costs, you’ve automatically qualified for this important program. There is no cost to participate.

items: Address any questions or problems you have about your medications
Address any concerns you have, such as cost issues, side effects or drug interactions
Provide advice on how to get the most benefit from the drugs you take
Provide guidance on topics to discuss with your provider
Access to a licensed pharmacist who will review all your prescription and over-the-counter medications
A To-Do List of the pharmacist’s recommendations to review with your provider
A Personal Medication List to track the medications you take and why they’re used

paragraph.string: To schedule your comprehensive medication review with a myMTMcare pharmacist call {hotline_phone}

Participation is optional. If you do not wish to participate, call toll-free at {hotline_phone} (TTY users should call 711), {hotline_hours}. You may continue to receive calls throughout the year until a formal request has been processed. If you remain an AllCare Advantage member, you can rejoin the program at any time. You may be offered MTM services again next year if you continue to qualify for the program.
When you complete a review with a myMTMcare pharmacist through our MTM program you will automatically qualify for a gift card in the amount of $15. Here are your choices:

items: fuel-only gift cards (e.g., Chevron, Shell, 76)
coffee-stands (houses) gift cards (e.g., Starbucks, Dutch Bros)
restaurant gift cards (e.g., Chipotle Mexican, Panda Express)
movie theater gift cards (e.g., Cinemark)
home improvement gift cards (e.g., The Home Depot, Lowes)

paragraph.string: After completing your review with a myMTMcare pharmacist, you may qualify for additional gift cards if you are taking certain high blood pressure medications (an angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitor or angiotensin receptor blocker), and you fill your prescription for a 100-day supply. Please contact AllCare Advantage at the number below for more information.

If you have any questions or do not want to take part in the AllCare Advantage MTM program, please call AllCare Health Customer Care at 541-471-4106 or toll free at 888-460-0185 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m., Monday through Friday.

We look forward to helping you live a healthier life.
Sincerely,

AllCare Advantage

Dear {patient_full_name},

We are offering a medication management program at no extra cost to help {hotline_name} members like you improve your health. You have been selected for this program to make sure you are on the safest and most effective medications for your health conditions. Our experienced pharmacists will help you achieve the following:

items:
BETTER HEALTH
A trained pharmacist will help you achieve the maximum benefit from your medications by making sure you are on the right medications for your specific health conditions. They will work with you and your health care providers to achieve your health goals. The pharmacist can also answer any questions you have about your medications so you can feel more informed.

INCREASED SAFETY
Some medications may cause side effects or may not work well when taken incorrectly or with other medicines. The pharmacist will make sure that you are taking the right combination of medications and provide tips on how to manage any side effects.

LOWER COSTS
The pharmacist can also look for ways to save you money by recommending lower cost options or removing any unnecessary medications.

paragraph.string:
You may receive a call from a pharmacist to talk about your medications. For more information or to speak to a pharmacist directly and take advantage of this free program you can call {hotline_phone} {hotline_hours}.

Sincerely,

{hotline_name}

paragraph.string: As part of your Priority Health Medicare plan, we’re pleased to welcome you into our Medication Therapy Management (MTM) program. Because you meet the program criteria based on the number of medications you take, the number of health conditions you have, and your annual prescription costs, you’ve automatically qualified for this important program. There is no cost to participate.

items: Address any questions or problems you have about your medications
Address any concerns you have, such as cost issues, side effects or drug interactions
Provide advice on how to get the most benefit from the drugs you take
Provide guidance on topics to discuss with your provider
Access to a licensed pharmacist who will review all your prescription and over-the-counter medications
A To-Do List of the pharmacist’s recommendations to review with your provider
A Personal Medication List to track the medications you take and why they’re used

paragraph.string: You won’t need to switch pharmacies to participate in this program, and you can continue to use any Priority Health Medicare network pharmacy to fill your prescriptions.
To schedule your comprehensive medication review, call 616.330.2898 or toll-free at 800.259.7314.

Participation is optional. If you do not wish to participate, call Customer Service toll-free at 888.389.6648 (TTY users should call 711), seven days a week from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. Or complete and return the attached form, and we will remove you from the program. You may continue to receive calls throughout the year until a formal request has been processed. If you remain a Priority Health Medicare member, you can rejoin the program at any time. You may be offered MTM services again next year if you continue to qualify for the program.
We look forward to helping you live a healthier life.

paragraph.string: Optimizing your medications can help improve your health. That’s why we are working with Arine to offer you a medication management program — at no extra cost — to help ensure you take medications that are safe and effective for your health conditions as prescribed by your doctor.

table_items.string: Better Health — A clinical pharmacist will make sure you are taking the right medications for your health conditions and help you understand how to correctly take all of your medications.

Increased safety — Some medications may cause side effects or may not work well when taken with other medications. A clinical pharmacist will provide tips on how to manage any side effects and make sure your combination of medications is safe.
Lower costs — A clinical pharmacist can look for ways to save you money on your medications and can work with your doctor to find lower cost options when appropriate.

paragraph.string: To get more information or to take advantage of this program at no extra cost, please call toll-free at {hotline_phone}, {hotline_hours}.

After you review this summary, it is important to place a copy of this letter in the patient's medical record for your reference and document CPT code 1111F to fulfill quality measures per CMS/HEDIS requirements.

text.string: According to the Paperwork Reduction Act of 1995, no persons are required to respond to a collection of information unless it displays a valid OMB control number. The valid OMB number for this information collection is 0938-1154. The time required to complete this information collection is estimated to average 40 minutes per response, including the time to review instructions, searching existing data resources, gather the data needed, and complete and review the information collection. If you have any comments concerning the accuracy of the time estimate(s) or suggestions for improving this form, please write to: CMS, Attn: PRA Reports Clearance Officer, 7500 Security Boulevard, Baltimore, Maryland 21244-1850

default.Spanish: De conformidad con la Ley de reducción de los trámites burocráticos de 1995, nadie estará obligado a responder a una solicitud de información a menos que se identifique con un número de control válido de la Oficina de Administración y Presupuesto. paragraph.string: Thank you for talking with me on {cmr_date} about your health and medications.

This letter shows your action plan (Medication Action Plan) and medication list (Personal Medication List). The action plan has steps you should take to help you get the best results from your medications. The medication list will help you keep track of your medications and make sure you take them the right way.

items: Have your action plan and medication list with you when you talk with your doctors, pharmacists, and other health care providers.
Ask your doctors, pharmacists, and other health care providers to update the action plan and medication list every time you have a medication change and at every visit.
With every medication change, have your doctor send in a new prescription to your pharmacy.
Take your medication list with you if you go to the hospital.
Give a copy of the action plan and medication list to your family or caregivers.

paragraph.string: {hotline_name} partners with Arine to provide Medication Therapy Management services, and we are happy to inform you that you are eligible for a medication review with a pharmacist. We are offering you the opportunity to review your medications over the telephone with a pharmacist to help make sure you are on the right medications and receiving the best possible care. This service is free of charge. During the review, we will try to answer three main questions:

default.Chinese: {hotline_name} 與 Arine 合作提供藥物治療管理服務，並且我們很高興地通知您，您符合由藥劑師為您執行藥物審查的資格。我們將為您提供一次藥物檢查機會，讓一位藥劑師透過電話對您的藥物進行檢查，以確保您目前服用的藥物適當，並獲得最佳護理。該服務免費提供。在檢查期間，我們將嘗試回答三個主要問題:
default.Spanish: {hotline_name} se asocia con Arine para brindarle servicios para la administración de farmacoterapia, y nos complace informarle que es elegible para una revisión de medicamentos con un farmacéutico. Le ofrecemos la oportunidad de revisar sus medicamentos por teléfono con un farmacéutico para asegurarnos de que tome los medicamentos correctos y reciba la mejor atención posible. Este servicio no tiene costo alguno para usted. En la revisión, se intentarán contestar las siguientes tres preguntas principales:

items: Are you on the best medicines for your medical conditions?
Are the medicines being used correctly?
Are there options for your medicines which will save you money?

Chinese: 您目前是否正在服用最適合您病症的藥物?
用藥方式是否恰當?
是否存在能幫您省錢的替代藥物?
Spanish: ¿Está tomando los medicamentos más apropiados para sus afecciones médicas?
¿Está tomando los medicamentos de forma correcta?
¿Existen otros medicamentos con los que podría ahorrar dinero?

paragraph.string: After the medication review, we will mail you an updated medication list and a recommended to-do list. This information can be shared and used to help you when you talk to your doctors at your next visit. Your doctor will help you decide if our suggestions are right for you.

paragraph.string: Health and wellness or prevention information

As part of your Excellus BlueCross BlueShield Medicare plan, we are pleased to welcome you into our Medication Therapy Management (MTM) program. You automatically qualify for this important program because you meet the program criteria based on the number of medications you take, the number of health conditions you have, and your yearly medication costs.

This service is free to you and can help you save money.

As part of your Univera Healthcare Medicare plan, we are pleased to welcome you into our Medication Therapy Management (MTM) program. You automatically qualify for this important program because you meet the program criteria based on the number of medications you take, the number of health conditions you have, and your yearly medication costs.

This service is free to you and can help you save money.

paragraph.string: What can MTM Medication Review do for you?

items: Talk about any concerns you have, such as side effects or drug interactions
Help with any problems you have regarding accessing or affording your medications
Talk about ways to get the best results from the drugs you take
A talk with a pharmacist who will review all your prescriptions and over-the-counter medications
A “To-Do-List” to help get the best results from your medications
A “Personal Medication List” to keep track of medications you are taking and why

paragraph.string: Want to participate? It’s simple and helpful:

items: To schedule your pharmacist review, call us at 1-800-424-4216 or TTY:711, Monday through Friday from 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. EST.

paragraph.string:
Sometimes our phone number begins with area code (401) instead of our (800) number. Please pick up when you see this number or call us today!

If you do not want to be in the MTM program, please call SafeRx within 30 days at 1-800-559-8426 and leave a message to opt out (TTY:711).

We look forward to helping you live a healthier life.

Warm Regards,
Your Medicare Pharmacy Management Team

paragraph.string: Elderplan is committed to ensuring our members receive high-quality care across the continuum of health services. Our approach integrates the management of behavioral, pharmacy, and physical health care benefits. We have implemented a drug management program to collaborate and assist you in providing safe, appropriate, and cost-effective care to patients. The program utilizes evidence-based drug utilization algorithms to identify any potential medication-related concerns.

This letter has been generated because we have identified a member-specific quality opportunity. Please review the information at the top of each page and the corresponding patient list to determine if a change in therapy can be made.

Elderplan pharmacist or a care manager may contact you to schedule a consultation to explain how the information can be used to support your prescribing decisions and to help manage potential medication related concerns. You may provide feedback or request additional data by contacting the Elderplan pharmacy department by email at EPPharmacyDepartment@mjhs.org or by fax at 929-275-3223 from 9 am to 5 pm EST, Monday to Friday.

All patients listed in this document have received a paid prescription with your national identification number (NPI) identified as the prescriber. Please be aware some of these patients may have received a prescription from you at a different site of service as this mailing is directed to the address primarily associated with your DEA.

The enclosed information is derived from pharmacy and medical claims data; however, additional claims paid by cash or other insurance will not be listed. If you receive information you believe to be inaccurate, please contact us by email at EPPharmacyDepartment@mjhs.org or by fax at 929-275-3223 and destroy the information in a confidential manner.

paragraph.string: Amount of Medicine (e.g. number of pills)

Statin Use in Persons with Diabetes (SUPD) is a Medicare Star Measure. We have reviewed our records and noticed that the patient below is currently not on a statin medication. As you know, it is recommended for patients with diabetes aged 40-75 years without atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease (ASCVD) to be started on a moderate-intensity statin for primary prevention. paragraph.string:
Dear {patient_full_name},

As part of your iCare Medicare plan, we’re pleased to welcome you into our Medication Therapy Management (MTM) program. Because you meet the program criteria based on the number of medications you take, the number of health conditions you have, and your annual prescription costs, you’ve automatically qualified for this important program. There is no cost to participate.

items: Address any questions or problems you have about your medications
Address any concerns you have, such as cost issues, side effects or drug interactions
Provide advice on how to get the most benefit from the drugs you take
Provide guidance on topics to discuss with your provider
Access to a licensed pharmacist who will review all your prescription and over-the-counter medications
A To-Do List of the pharmacist’s recommendations to review with your provider
A Personal Medication List to track the medications you take and why they’re used

paragraph.string: To schedule your comprehensive medication review call {hotline_phone}

Don’t want to participate?

Participation is optional. If you do not wish to participate, call Customer Service toll-free at {hotline_phone} (TTY users should call 711), seven days a week from 9:00 a.m. CST to 7:00 p.m. CST, Monday through Sunday. You may continue to receive calls throughout the year until a formal request has been processed. If you remain an iCare Medicare member, you can rejoin the program at any time. You may be offered MTM services again next year if you continue to qualify for the program.

We look forward to helping you live a healthier life.

Sincerely,

iCare

paragraph.string: Prime Therapeutics, in partnership with Idaho Department of Health and Welfare, is committed to providing quality, evidence-based pharmacy services to our members. To collaborate and assist you in providing safe, appropriate, and cost-effective care to your patients, we have implemented the Whole Health Rx Consultation Program. As part of this program, drug utilization algorithms centered on evidence-based guidelines are utilized to identify potential drug therapy concerns.

This letter has been generated because we have identified a member-specific quality opportunity. Please review the clinical information at the top of each page and the corresponding patient list to determine if a change in therapy can be made.

This program is informational in nature and is not intended to replace your authority, responsibility, or accountability for patient care. The Whole Health Rx pharmacist and consultations are not a substitute for your professional judgment, but rather a resource and enhancement to your expertise.

A clinical pharmacist may contact you to schedule a consultation to discuss how this information can be used to support your prescribing decisions, improve quality of care, and reduce the risks of adverse events. You may also request a personal consultation, provide feedback, or request additional data by contacting your clinical pharmacist at:

The enclosed information is derived from Prime Therapeutics pharmacy claims data with your national identification number (NPI) identified as the prescriber. Additional claims paid by cash or other insurance will not be listed. Please be aware some of these patients may have received a prescription from you at a different site of service as this mailing is directed to the address primarily associated with your NPI.
If you receive information that you believe to be inaccurate, please contact the Whole Health Rx toll free number (800)-243-3771 and destroy the information in a confidential manner.

Kristen Cherwinski, PharmD
Clinical Pharmacist Specialist
Prime Therapeutics

paragraph.string:
Dear {patient_full_name},

We are offering a medication management program at no extra cost to help {hotline_name} members like you improve your health. You have been selected for this program to make sure you are on the safest and most effective medicines for your health conditions. Our experienced pharmacists will help you achieve the following:

items:
BETTER HEALTH
A trained pharmacist will help you achieve the maximum benefit from you and your medicines by making sure you are on the right medicines for your specific health conditions.

INCREASED SAFETY
Some medicines may cause side effects or may not work well when taken incorrectly or with other medicines. The pharmacist will make sure that you are taking the right combination of medicines and provide tips on how to manage any side effects.

LOWER COSTS
The pharmacist can also look for ways to save you money by recommending lower cost options or removing any unnecessary medicines.

paragraph.string: Take advantage of this program at no extra cost by calling for more information or to speak to a pharmacist directly toll-free at {hotline_phone}, {hotline_hours}.
Kaiser Foundation Health Plan of Washington

paragraph.string: Alohacare is committed to ensuring our members receive integrated and high-quality care. Our approach integrates the management of behavioral, pharmacy and physical health care benefits. We have implemented a Quality Improvement Program to collaborate and assist you in providing safe, appropriate, and cost-effective care to patients. As part of this program, drug utilization algorithms based on evidence-based guidelines are utilized to identify any potential medication-related concerns.

This letter has been generated because we have identified a member-specific quality opportunity. Please review the information at the top of each page and the corresponding patient list to determine if a change in therapy can be made.

A clinical pharmacist may contact you to schedule a consultation and explain how the information can be used to support your prescribing decisions and help reduce the risks of adverse effects. You may also request a personal consultation, provide feedback, or request additional data by contacting your dedicated pharmacist at 808-973-7418

All patients listed in this document have received a paid prescription with your national identification number (NPI) identified as the prescriber. Please be aware some of these patients may have received a prescription from you at a different site of service as this mailing is directed to the address primarily associated with your DEA.

The enclosed information is derived from pharmacy and medical claims data; however, additional claims paid by cash or other insurance will not be listed. If you receive information you believe to be inaccurate, please contact our toll-free number at 808-973-7418 and destroy the information in a confidential manner.

Hanh Bannister, Pharm.D., MBA
Alohacare Quality Improvement Program

We are offering a medication management program at no extra cost to help United Healthcare members like you improve your health. You have been selected for this program to make sure you are on safe and effective medicines for your health conditions. Our experienced pharmacists will help you achieve the following:

items:
Better Health
A trained pharmacist will help you achieve great benefit from your medicines by making sure you are on the right medicines for your specific health conditions.

Increased safety
Some medicines may cause side effects or may not work well when taken incorrectly or with other medicines. The pharmacist will make sure that you are taking the right combination of medicines and also provide tips on how to manage any side effects.

Lower costs

table_items.string: Bring your To-Do List when you go to your doctor. And, share it with your family or caregivers.

paragraph.string: The Michigan Department of Health and Human Services is committed to providing quality and evidence-based pharmacy services to behavioral health patients. In an effort to collaborate and assist you in providing safe, appropriate, and cost-effective care to your patients, we have implemented the Prime Therapeutics Whole Health Rx Consultation Program. As part of this program, drug utilization algorithms based on evidence based guidelines are used to identify any potential drug therapy concerns.

This letter has been generated because we have identified a member-specific quality opportunity. Please review the clinical information at the top of each page and the corresponding patient list to determine if a change in therapy can be made.
This program is informational in nature and is not intended to replace your authority, responsibility, or accountability for patient care.

A clinical pharmacist may contact you to schedule a consultation or come to your office to meet with you to discuss how the information can be used to improve the quality of care and reduce the risks of adverse events. You can also use the contact information below to contact a clinical pharmacist to request a personal consultation, provide feedback, ask questions, or request additional data.

All patients listed in this document have received a paid prescription with your national identification number (NPI) identified as the prescriber. Please be aware some of these patients may have received a prescription from you at a different site of service as this mailing is directed to the address primarily associated with your DEA.

Trish M. Bouck, MPA, RN
Director, Pharmacy Management Division
Bureau of Medicaid Care Management & Quality Assurance
Medical Services Administration
Michigan Department of Health and Human Services cc:
Enclosure

paragraph.string: Storing your medications safely and disposing of the ones you no longer need can make a difference when it comes to preventing medication injuries. It can also prevent medications from getting into the wrong hands.

items: Make sure your medications are stored in their original container and the cap is on tight.
Place your medications in a safe location and never leave it in an unsecured place, such as the kitchen counter.
Store your medications where children cannot see or reach them.
Dispose of medications you no longer use or are expired as soon as possible. This will prevent you and others from accidentally taking medications you no longer need.
The preferred way of disposing unused controlled medications is to bring them to community take-back sites near you.
Before bringing your medications to take-back sites, use a marker to cover any personal information, such as your name or prescription number. Two medication take-back sites in your community are:

The US Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) allows unused prescription medications to be mailed back to pharmacies or other authorized sites using packages made available at pharmacies or other drug disposal sites. Contact your local pharmacy prior to mailing unused medications.

Other medication collection sites in your area and information about medication disposal may be found at the websites below:
o       Information regarding drug take back: https://www.deatakeback.com/
o       Additional take-back sites near you: https://bit.ly/3guWP4x

English: The preferred way of disposing unused controlled medications is to bring them to community take-back sites near you.
Before bringing your medications to take-back sites, use a marker to cover any personal information, such as your name or prescription number. Two medication take-back sites in your community are:

The US Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) allows unused prescription medications to be mailed back to pharmacies or other authorized sites using packages made available at pharmacies or other drug disposal sites. Contact your local pharmacy prior to mailing unused medications.

Other medication collection sites in your area and information about medication disposal may be found at the websites below:
o       Information regarding drug take back: https://www.deatakeback.com/
o       Additional take-back sites near you: https://apps2.deadiversion.usdoj.gov/pubdispsearch/spring/main?execution=e2s1

items: Remove the medications from their original containers and mix them with something undesirable, such as used coffee grounds, dirt, or cat litter.
Put the mixture in something you can close, such as a zip-lock bag, to prevent the medicine from spilling out. Then throw the container in the trash.
Some prescription medications may be safely flushed. Please visit https://bit.ly/3TmFnO2 for a list of flushable medications.
If you have any questions about your medications, ask your doctor or pharmacist.

English: Remove the medications from their original containers and mix them with something undesirable, such as used coffee grounds, dirt, or cat litter.
Put the mixture in something you can close, such as a zip-lock bag, to prevent the medicine from spilling out. Then throw the container in the trash.

Some prescription medications may be safely flushed. Please visit https://www.fda.gov/drugs/disposal-unused-medicines-what-you-should-know/drug-disposal-fdas- flush-list-certain-medicines for a list of flushable medications.
If you have any questions about your medications, ask your doctor or pharmacist.

paragraph.string:
Dear {patient_full_name},

As part of your {patient_sub_org_name} Medicare plan, we’re pleased to welcome you into our Medication Therapy Management (MTM) program. Because you meet the program criteria based on the number of medications you take, the number of health conditions you have, and your annual prescription costs, you’ve automatically qualified for this important program. There is no cost to participate.

Storing your medications safely and disposing of the ones you no longer need can make a difference when it comes to preventing medication injuries. It can also prevent medications from getting into the wrong hands.

items: Make sure your medications are stored in their original container and the cap is on tight.
Place your medications in a safe location and never leave it in an unsecured place, such as the kitchen counter.
Store your medications where children cannot see or reach them.
Dispose of medications you no longer use or are expired as soon as possible. This will prevent you and others from accidentally taking medications you no longer need.
The preferred way of disposing unused controlled medications is to bring them to community take-back sites near you.
Before bringing your medications to take-back sites, use a marker to cover any personal information, such as your name or prescription number. Two medication take-back sites in your community are:

The US Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) allows unused prescription medications to be mailed back to pharmacies or other authorized sites using packages made available at pharmacies or other drug disposal sites. Contact your local pharmacy prior to mailing unused medications.

Other medication collection sites in your area and information about medication disposal may be found at the websites below:
o       Information regarding drug take back: https://www.deatakeback.com/
o       Additional take-back sites near you: https://apps2.deadiversion.usdoj.gov/pubdispsearch/spring/main?execution=e2s1
Remove the medications from their original containers and mix them with something undesirable, such as used coffee grounds, dirt, or cat litter.
Put the mixture in something you can close, such as a zip-lock bag, to prevent the medicine from spilling out. Then throw the container in the trash.

Some prescription medications may be safely flushed. Please visit https://www.fda.gov/drugs/disposal-unused-medicines-what-you-should-know/drug-disposal-fdas- flush-list-certain-medicines for a list of flushable medications.
If you have any questions about your medications, ask your doctor or pharmacist.

paragraph.string: For additional information on the safe disposal of medications, please contact your local pharmacy, police department or visit: www.hhs.gov/opioids/prevention/safely-dispose-drugs/index.html

paragraph.string: Blue Cross® and Blue Shield® of Vermont is committed to ensuring our members receive seamless and highquality care. Our approach integrates the management of behavioral, pharmacy and physical health care benefits. We have implemented a Provider Outreach Program to collaborate and assist you in providing safe, appropriate, and cost-effective care to patients. As part of this program, drug utilization algorithms based on evidence-based guidelines are utilized to identify any potential medication-related concerns.

This letter has been generated because we have identified a member-specific opportunity. Please review the information at the top of each page and the corresponding patient list to determine if a change in therapy should be made.

A clinical pharmacist may contact you to schedule a consultation and explain how the information can be used to support your prescribing decisions and help reduce the risks of adverse effects. You may also request a personal consultation, provide feedback, or request additional data by contacting your dedicated pharmacist at 1-802-491-3297.

All patients listed in this document have received a prescription with your National Provider Identifier (NPI) number identified as the prescriber. Please be aware that some of these patients may have received a prescription from you at a different site of service, as this mailing is directed to the address primarily associated with your DEA.

The enclosed information is derived from pharmacy and medical claims data; additional claims paid by cash or other insurance will not be listed. If you receive information you believe to be inaccurate, please contact our tollfree number at 1-802-491-3297 and destroy the information in a confidential manner.

Blue Cross® and Blue Shield® of Vermont

paragraph.string:
Dear {patient_full_name},

As part of your {hotline_name} plan, we’re pleased to welcome you into our Medication Therapy Management (MTM) program. Because you meet the program criteria based on the number of medications you take, the number of health conditions you have, and your annual prescription costs, you’ve automatically qualified for this important program. There is no cost to participate.

default.Spanish:
Estimado {patient_full_name},

Como parte de su Plan {hotline_name}, nos complace darle la bienvenida a nuestro Programa de Gestión de Terapia de Medicamentos (Medication Therapy Management, MTM). Dado que cumple con los criterios del programa según la cantidad de medicamentos que se administra, la cantidad de afecciones médicas que padece y los costos anuales de sus medicamentos recetados, puede recibir los beneficios de este importante programa de forma automática. Participar no tiene ningún costo.
¿Qué puede hacer por usted el programa MTM?

items: Address any questions or problems you have about your medications
Address any concerns you have, such as cost issues, side effects or drug interactions
Provide advice on how to get the most benefit from the drugs you take
Provide guidance on topics to discuss with your provider

Spanish: Abordar cualquier pregunta o problema que tenga en relación con sus medicamentos.
Abordar cualquier inquietud que tenga, como problemas referentes a los costos, efectos secundarios o interacciones con otros medicamentos.
Brindar consejos sobre cómo obtener el máximo beneficio de los medicamentos que se administra.
Brindar orientación sobre determinados temas que puede analizar con su proveedor.

items: Access to a licensed pharmacist who will review all your prescription and over-the-counter medications
A To-Do List of the pharmacist’s recommendations to review with your provider
A Personal Medication List to track the medications you take and why they’re used

Spanish: Acceso a un farmacéutico con licencia que revisará todos sus medicamentos recetados y de venta libre.
Una lista de tareas pendientes que incluye las recomendaciones del farmacéutico respecto a lo que debe revisar con su proveedor.
Una lista de medicamentos personales para que lleve un registro de los medicamentos que se administra y los motivos de su administración.

paragraph.string: How to Safely Dispose of Unused Prescription Medications

Storing your medications safely and disposing of the ones you no longer need can make a difference when it comes to preventing medication injuries. It can also prevent medications from getting into the wrong hands.

default.Chinese: 請安全地存放藥物並處理掉您不再需要的藥物，這樣做不僅可以有效避免藥物傷害，還能防止藥物落入壞人之手。
default.Spanish: Almacenar sus medicamentos de manera segura y desechar los que ya no necesita puede hacer una diferencia en la prevención de lesiones causadas por medicamentos. También puede evitar que los medicamentos caigan en las manos equivocadas.
Cómo almacenar los medicamentos de manera segura:

items: Make sure your medications are stored in their original container and the cap is tight.
Place your medications in a safe location and never leave it in an unsecured place, such as the kitchen counter.
Store your medications where children cannot see or reach them.

Chinese: 確保您的藥物存放在原來的容器中，並且蓋緊了蓋子。
將藥物放在安全的地方，而切勿將其放在沒有安全保障的地方，如廚房櫃檯。
將藥物存放在兒童看不到或夠不著的地方。
Spanish: Conserve los medicamentos en sus envases originales con la tapa bien cerrada.
Coloque los medicamentos en un lugar seguro y no los deje nunca en un lugar que no sea seguro, como la encimera de la cocina.
Guarde los medicamentos en un sitio donde los niños no puedan verlos ni alcanzarlos.

default.Spanish: Cómo deshacerse de los medicamentos de forma segura:

items: Dispose of medications you no longer use or are expired as soon as possible. This will prevent you and others from accidentally taking medications you no longer need.

Chinese: 盡快處理您不再使用或過期的藥物。這將防止您和其他人意外地服用您不再需要的藥物。
Spanish: Deseche los medicamentos que ya no usa o que están vencidos lo antes posible. Esto evitará que usted u otras personas tomen accidentalmente medicamentos que ya no necesitan.

default.Spanish: Programas de devolución de medicamentos cerca de su domicilio:

items: The preferred way of disposing unused controlled medications is to bring them to community take-back sites near you.
Before bringing your medications to take-back sites, use a marker to cover any personal information, such as your name or prescription number. Two medication take-back sites in your community are:

Chinese: 處理未使用的受管制藥物的首選方式是將它們帶到您附近的社區回收點。
在將藥物帶到回收點之前，請使用記號筆塗抹掉任何個人資訊，例如您的姓名或處方號。您所在社區的兩個藥物回收點是:
Spanish: La mejor forma de desechar los medicamentos controlados sin usar es llevarlos a los sitios de devolución de la comunidad cerca de su domicilio.

Antes de llevar sus medicamentos a los sitios de devolución, cubra con un marcador cualquier información personal, como su nombre o número de receta. Los siguientes son dos sitios de devolución de medicamentos en su comunidad:

items: The US Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) allows unused prescription medications to be mailed back to pharmacies or other authorized sites using packages made available at pharmacies or other drug disposal sites. Contact your local pharmacy prior to mailing unused medications.

Other medication collection sites in your area and information about medication disposal may be found at the websites below:
o       Information regarding drug take back: https://www.deatakeback.com/
o       Additional take-back sites near you: https://apps2.deadiversion.usdoj.gov/pubdispsearch/spring/main?execution=e2s1

Chinese: 美國緝毒署 (Drug Enforcement Administration, DEA) 允許您使用藥房或其他藥物處理點提供的包裝，將未使用的處方藥郵寄回藥房或其他授權點。在郵寄未使用的藥物前，請聯絡您當地的 藥房。

您可在以下網站找到您所在地區的其他藥物收集點和有關藥物處理的資訊:
o       有關藥物回收的資訊: https://www.deatakeback.com/
o       您附近的其他回收點: https://apps2.deadiversion.usdoj.gov/pubdispsearch/spring/main?execution=e2s1
Spanish: La Administración para el Control de Drogas (Drug Enforcement Administration, DEA) de los EE. UU. permite que los medicamentos con receta sin usar se devuelvan por correo a las farmacias u otros sitios autorizados utilizando paquetes disponibles en las farmacias u otros sitios para la eliminación de medicamentos. Comuníquese con su farmacia local antes de enviar por correo los medicamentos sin usar.

Puede encontrar otros sitios de recolección de medicamentos en su área e información sobre cómo desechar los medicamentos en los siguientes sitios web:
o       Información sobre la devolución de los medicamentos: https://www.deatakeback.com/
o       Otros sitios de devolución cerca de su domicilio: https://apps2.deadiversion.usdoj.gov/pubdispsearch/spring/main?execution=e2s1

English: The US Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) allows unused prescription medications to be mailed back to pharmacies or other authorized sites using packages made available at pharmacies or other drug disposal sites. Contact your local pharmacy prior to mailing unused medications.

Other medication collection sites in your area and information about medication disposal may be found at the websites below:
o       Information regarding drug take back: https://www.deatakeback.com/
o       Additional take-back sites near you: https://bit.ly/3guWP4x
Spanish: La Administración para el Control de Drogas (Drug Enforcement Administration, DEA) de los EE. UU. permite que los medicamentos con receta sin usar se devuelvan por correo a las farmacias u otros sitios autorizados utilizando paquetes disponibles en las farmacias u otros sitios para la eliminación de medicamentos. Comuníquese con su farmacia local antes de enviar por correo los medicamentos sin usar.

Puede encontrar otros sitios de recolección de medicamentos en su área e información sobre cómo desechar los medicamentos en los siguientes sitios web:
o       Información sobre la devolución de los medicamentos: https://www.deatakeback.com/
o       Otros sitios de devolución cerca de su domicilio: https://bit.ly/3guWP4x

default.Spanish: Otras formas de deshacerse de los medicamentos:

items: Remove the medications from their original containers and mix them with something undesirable, such as used coffee grounds, dirt, or cat litter.
Put the mixture in something you can close, such as a zip-lock bag, to prevent the medicine from spilling out. Then throw the container in the trash.

Some prescription medications may be safely flushed. Please visit https://www.fda.gov/drugs/disposal-unused-medicines-what-you-should-know/drug-disposal-fdas-flush-list-certain-medicines for a list of flushable medications.
If you have any questions about your medications, ask your doctor or pharmacist.

Chinese: 從原來的容器中取出藥物，將其與不需要的東西混合，如用過的咖啡渣、泥土或貓砂。
將混合物放入可以封閉的容器(例如一個拉鏈袋)內，以防止藥物溢出。然後將容器扔進 垃圾桶。
某些處方藥可以安全地沖走。請瀏覽 <u>https://www.fda.gov/drugs/disposal-unused-medicines-what-you-should-know/drug-disposal-fdas-flush-list-certain-medicines</u> 查看可沖走的藥物清單。
如果您對藥物有任何疑問，請諮詢您的醫生或藥劑師。
Spanish: Retire los medicamentos de sus envases originales y mézclelos con alguna sustancia desagradable, como granos de café usados, tierra o arena sanitaria para gatos.
Coloque la mezcla en algún contenedor que pueda cerrar como una bolsa con cierre hermético, para evitar que el medicamento se derrame. Luego, tire el recipiente a la basura.

Algunos medicamentos recetados pueden desecharse por el inodoro de manera segura. Ingrese en link <u>https://www.fda.gov/drugs/disposal-unused-medicines-what-you-should-know/drug-disposal-fdas-flush-list-certain-medicines</u> para obtener un listado de los medicamentos que se pueden desechar por el inodoro.
Si tiene alguna pregunta sobre sus medicamentos, consulte a su médico o farmacéutico.

English: Remove the medications from their original containers and mix them with something undesirable, such as used coffee grounds, dirt, or cat litter.
Put the mixture in something you can close, such as a zip-lock bag, to prevent the medicine from spilling out. Then throw the container in the trash.
Some prescription medications may be safely flushed. Please visit https://bit.ly/3TmFnO2 for a list of flushable medications.
If you have any questions about your medications, ask your doctor or pharmacist.
Spanish: Retire los medicamentos de sus envases originales y mézclelos con alguna sustancia desagradable, como granos de café usados, tierra o arena sanitaria para gatos.
Coloque la mezcla en algún contenedor que pueda cerrar como una bolsa con cierre hermético, para evitar que el medicamento se derrame. Luego, tire el recipiente a la basura.

Algunos medicamentos recetados pueden desecharse por el inodoro de manera segura. Ingrese en <u>https://bit.ly/3TmFnO2</u> para obtener un listado de los medicamentos que se pueden desechar por el inodoro.
Si tiene alguna pregunta sobre sus medicamentos, consulte a su médico o farmacéutico.

paragraph.string: For additional information on the safe disposal of medications, please contact your local pharmacy, police department or visit: www.hhs.gov/opioids/prevention/safely-dispose-drugs/index.html

default.Chinese: 如需獲取有關安全處理藥物的其他資訊，請聯絡您當地的藥店、警署，或瀏覽: <u>www.hhs.gov/opioids/prevention/safely-dispose-drugs/index.html</u>

You’ve been selected for this program to make sure you’re on the safest and most effective medicines for your health conditions. Our experienced pharmacists will help you achieve the following:

items:
BETTER HEALTH
A trained pharmacist will help you achieve the maximum benefit from your medicines by making sure you are on the right medicines for your specific health conditions.

INCREASED SAFETY
Some medicines may cause side effects or may not work well when taken incorrectly or with other medicines. The pharmacist will make sure you’re taking the right combination of medicines and provide tips on how to manage any side effects.

LOWER COSTS
The pharmacist can also look for ways to save you money by recommending lower cost options or removing any unnecessary medicines.

paragraph.string: Take advantage of this program at no extra cost by calling for more information or to speak to a pharmacist directly toll-free at {hotline_phone} {hotline_hours}.

Mihir Patel, PharmD, RPh
Chief Pharmacy Officer

This letter includes your updated medication list and personalized action plan.
The action plan has steps you should take to help you get the best results from your medications. The medication list will help you keep track of your medications and how to use them the right way.

items: Have your action plan and medication list with you when you talk with your doctors, pharmacists, and other health care providers.
Ask your doctors, pharmacists, and other health care providers to update the action plan and medication list every time you have a medication change and at every visit.
With every medication change, have your doctor send in a new prescription to your pharmacy.
Take your medication list with you if you go to the hospital.
Give a copy of the action plan and medication list to your family or caregivers.

paragraph.string: Thank you for working with {hotline_name} to make sure your medicines are helping you feel better and are taken safely. We reviewed your medications on {review_date}.

This letter has your action plan (Medication Action Plan) and medication list (Personal Medication List). The action plan has steps you should take to help you get the best results from your medications. The medication list will help you keep track of your medications and make sure you take them the right way.

items: Have your action plan and medication list with you when you talk with your doctors, pharmacists, and other health care providers.
Ask your doctors, pharmacists, and other health care providers to update the action plan and medication list every time you have a medication change and at every visit.
With every medication change, have your doctor send in a new prescription to your pharmacy.
Take your medication list with you if you go to the hospital.
Give a copy of the action plan and medication list to your family or caregivers.

paragraph.string: If you want to talk about this letter or any of the other materials, you can call {hotline_name} member services at {hotline_phone} and ask for a pharmacist to call you back. We are available {hotline_hours}. From October 1-March 31, we are available 7 days a week, 8:00 am - 8:00 pm. We look forward to working with you to help you be as healthy as possible.
Pharmacist and Physician Advanced Medication Review (AMR) Program

Aloha Care is committed to ensuring that our members receive integrated and high-quality care. As part of our Pharmacist and Physician Advanced Medication Review (AMR) program, drug utilization algorithms built on evidence-based guidelines were used to identify potential drug-related concerns, quality care gaps and other healthcare opportunities for your patients with Aloha Care health plan coverage.

Based on our records, we have identified quality opportunities for one or more patients under your care. Please review the information for each patient to determine if intervention is clinically appropriate, then, take steps, if necessary. A Aloha Care clinical pharmacist may contact you to schedule a consultation to further review the identified opportunities and offer support.

The enclosed information is derived from pharmacy and medical claims data. Claims paid by cash or other insurance will not be listed. If you receive information that you believe to be inaccurate, please contact Aloha Care Pharmacy Services at 1-800- 535-9481 and destroy the inaccurate information in a confidential manner.

paragraph.string: SCAN partners with Arine to provide Medication Therapy Management services, and we are happy to inform you that you are eligible for a medication review with a pharmacist. We are offering you the opportunity to review your medications over the telephone with a pharmacist to help make sure you are on the right medications and receiving the best possible care. This service is free of charge. During the review, we will try to answer three main questions:

default.Chinese: SCAN 與 Arine 合作提供藥物治療管理服務，並且我們很高興地通知您，您符合由藥劑師為您執行藥物審查的資格。我們將為您提供一次藥物檢查機會，讓一位藥劑師透過電話對您的藥物進行檢查，以確保您目前服用的藥物適當，並獲得最佳護理。該服務免費提供。在檢查期間，我們將嘗試回答三個主要問題:
default.Spanish: SCAN se asocia con Arine para brindarle servicios para la administración de farmacoterapia, y nos complace informarle que es elegible para una revisión de medicamentos con un farmacéutico. Le ofrecemos la oportunidad de revisar sus medicamentos por teléfono con un farmacéutico para asegurarnos de que tome los medicamentos correctos y reciba la mejor atención posible. Este servicio no tiene costo alguno para usted. En la revisión, se intentarán contestar las siguientes tres preguntas principales:

items: Are you on the best medicines for your medical conditions?
Are the medicines being used correctly?
Are there options for your medicines which will save you money?

Chinese: 您目前是否正在服用最適合您病症的藥物?
用藥方式是否恰當?
是否存在能幫您省錢的替代藥物?
Spanish: ¿Está tomando los medicamentos más apropiados para sus afecciones médicas?
¿Está tomando los medicamentos de forma correcta?
¿Existen otros medicamentos con los que podría ahorrar dinero?

paragraph.string: After the medication review, we will mail you an updated medication list and a recommended to-do list. This information can be shared and used to help you when you talk to your doctors at your next visit. Your doctor will help you decide if our suggestions are right for you.

default.Chinese: 在藥物審查後，我們將向您郵寄更新的藥物清單和建議的待辦事項清單。如果您在下次就診時與您的醫生交談，可以分享這些資訊並用於向您提供幫助。您的醫生將幫助您確定我們的建議是否適合您。

paragraph.string:
Dear {patient_full_name},

As part of your {hotline_name} plan, we’re pleased to welcome you into our Medication Therapy Management (MTM) program. Because you meet the requirements, you’ve automatically qualified for this important program. There is no cost to participate.

default.Chinese:
尊敬的客夠 {patient_full_name}.

作為您 {hotline_name} 計劃的一部分，很歡迎您加入我們的藥物治療管理 (MTM) 計 劃。由於您已符合方案要求，因此您已自動獲得參加此重要方案的資格。而無需任何額外費 用。
default.Spanish:
Estimada/o {patient_full_name},

Como parte de su plan {hotline_name}, nos complace darle la bienvenida a nuestro programa de Manejo de Terapia de Medicamentos (MTM). Debido a que cumple con los requisitos, automáticamente califica para este importante programa. No hay ningún costo para participar.

default.Chinese: MTM 能為您提供甚麼服務？

items: Answer any questions or concerns you might have about your medications
Help with any problems you might have, such as cost, side effects, or drug interactions
Provide advice on how to talk to your provider about the drugs you take

Chinese: 可以回答您對藥物可能有的任何問題或疑慮
可以幫助解決您可能遇到的問題，例如費用、副作用或藥物交互作用
可以提供建議夠您如何與您的處方人員討論有關您所服用藥物
Spanish: Responder cualquier pregunta o inquietud que pueda tener sobre sus medicamentos
Ayudar con cualquier problema que pueda tener, como costo, efectos secundarios o interacciones entre medicamentos
Proporcionarle consejos sobre cómo hablar con su proveedor sobre los medicamentos que toma

default.Chinese: 當您參與時會得到甚麼？

items: A phone call with a licensed pharmacist who will review all your prescription and over-the-counter medications
A To-Do List of the pharmacist’s recommendations to discuss with your provider
A Personal Medication List to track the medications you take and why they’re used

Chinese: 可以與執業藥劑師通電話，讓他審視您的所有處方藥物和非處方藥物
藥劑師會建議－份待辦事項清單，供您與您的處方提供者討論
夠您提供一份個人藥物清單，方便您知道所服用的藥物及使用原因
Spanish: Una llamada telefónica con un farmacéutico autorizado que revisará todos sus medicamentos recetados y de venta libre
Una lista de "cosas por hacer" con las recomendaciones del farmacéutico para discutir con su proveedor
Una lista personal de medicamentos para llevar un control de los medicamentos que toma y por qué se usan

default.Chinese: 如果您想參加此計劃, 現在就可以開始

paragraph.string:
If you do not wish to participate, call Customer Service toll-free at {hotline_phone} (TTY users should call 711), {hotline_hours}. You may continue to get calls from us until you call. If you remain a {hotline_name} Medicare member, you can rejoin the program at any time during the year by calling {hotline_phone}. You may be offered MTM services again next year if you meet the requirements.

We look forward to helping you live a healthier life.
Sincerely,

{hotline_name}

paragraph.string: Healthfirst is committed to ensuring our members receive integrated and high-quality care. We have implemented a Quality Improvement Program to collaborate and assist you in providing safe, appropriate, and cost-effective care to patients. The intent of this program is to identify any potential medication-related concerns.

You are receiving this letter because we have identified specific deprescribing opportunities for Healthfirst members under your care. The identified members appear to be taking medications that may be duplicative or potentially inappropriate based on their medical conditions. Please review the information at the top of each page and the corresponding patient list to determine if it is clinically appropriate to discontinue any of the medications. Please contact the patient as needed with further actions.

A clinical pharmacist may contact you to schedule a consultation and explain how the information can be used to support your prescribing decisions and reduce the risks of adverse effects. You may also request a personal consultation, provide feedback, or request additional data by contacting your dedicated pharmacist at 1-212-301-8728.

All enclosed information is derived from Healthfirst claims data. If you receive information you believe to be inaccurate, please call our toll-free number at 1-212-301-8728 and destroy the information in a confidential manner.
Thank you for your continued care of our members.

Daniel Halevy, M.D., FASN, CPC-A
Vice President, Senior Medical Director
Healthfirst Quality Improvement Program
